intro: Hoya thuathienhuensis, commonly known as the Thai Hoya or Thai Star, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asclepiadaceae. It is native to Thailand and is characterized by its waxy, elliptical leaves and clusters of star-shaped, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or vine, often found in shaded, humid environments. Its flowers, which bloom in shades of white and pink, are highly ornamental and attract pollinators such as moths and bees. Hoya thuathienhuensis is prized in horticulture for its beauty and relatively easy care requirements.
